dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6078 IH: Grants for Resources in Occupational and Workforce Training for Healthcare Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ciscomani (for himself, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, Mr. James, Mr. Trone, Mrs. Kiggans of Virginia, and Ms. Perez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Acts to make community colleges eligible to participate in the Nurse Education, Practice, Quality, and Retention–Pathway to Registered Nurse Program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Grants for Resources in Occupational and Workforce Training for Healthcare Act of 2023 or the GROWTH Act of 2023.

section.header: Participation of community colleges in the Nurse Education, Practice, Quality, and Retention–Pathway to Registered Nurse Program

subsection.text: Section 831(f) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 296p(f)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: a health care facility, such as a Federally qualified health center or nurse-managed health clinic; and
a partnership of such a school or college and such a facility.

paragraph.text: The term junior or community college means—

subparagraph.text: a public institution of higher education, including additional locations, at which the highest awarded degree, or the predominantly awarded degree, is an associate degree; or
any Tribal College or University (as defined in section 316 of the Higher Education Act of 1965).

subsection.text: Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 296p), as amended, is further amended by adding at the end the following:

Of the total amount awarded to eligible entities under this section for a fiscal year, the Secretary shall, with respect to a portion of such total amount to be determined by the Secretary, not to exceed 50 percent of such total amount, give priority to eligible entities that are—

paragraph.text: a junior or community college with an existing nursing program; or
a partnership referred to in subsection (f)(1)(D).
